alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:08PM EDT until July 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT/830 PM EDT/ FOR WARRICK...NORTHEASTERN VANDERBURGH...EASTERN GIBSON AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 708 PM CDT/808 PM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Patoka to 6 miles north of Chandler to Newburgh, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Princeton, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Fort Branch, Oakland City, Petersburg, Melody Hill, Haubstadt, Lynnville, Winslow, Patoka, Folsomville, Elberfeld, Francisco, Somerville, Hazleton, Spurgeon and Mackey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana near Mile Marker 2, and between Mile Markers 7 and 52. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 25 and 52. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
